trial_identification.studytitle: Irinotecan Plus E7820 Versus FOLFIRI in Second-Line Therapy in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Colon or Rectal Cancer
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An Open-Label, Multicenter, Randomized Phase Ib/II Study of Irinotecan Plus E7820 Versus FOLFIRI in Second-Line Therapy in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Colon or Rectal Cancer

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Bowel - Back passage (rectum) or large bowel (colon)

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - FOLFIRI Treatment: drugs - E7820
Active Comparator: 1 - Experimental Irinotecan plus E7820
Active Comparator: 2 - FOLFIRI alone
Treatment: drugs: FOLFIRI Comparator dose and mode of administration The FOLFIRI regimen consists of irinotecan at 180 mg/m2 (IV infusion) on Day 1 of each 14-day cycle, leucovorin at 200 mg/m2 (400 mg/m2 if using d,l-racemic mixture of leucovorin) by IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle, and 5-FU at 400 mg/m2 as an IV bolus injection followed by a total of 2400 mg/m2 by continuous IV infusion over 46 hours over Days 1 and 2 via an ambulatory programmable pump (the use of an ambulatory pump is optional).
Treatment: drugs: E7820 Test product: dose and mode of administration: E7820 is administered orally in tablet form once daily, every day of each 14-day treatment cycle. For the Phase Ib portion, the doses will be 40 mg/day, 70 mg/day, and 100 mg/day, and for the Pase II portion, the dose will be the MTD in combination with Irinotecan, as determined during the Phase ib portion of the study. The irinotecan regimen consists of an irinotecan dose of 180 mg/m2 by IV infusion once every 2 weeks (Day 1 of each 14-day cycle).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety parameter: adverse events - Phase Ib: to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of E7820 recommended for Phase II when administered in combination with Irinotecan in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy; Phase II: to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E7820 administered in combination with Irinotecan compared with FOLFIRI alone, in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC)who have failed first-line therapy.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Participants will be followed for the duration of the study, an expected average of 18 months

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety Parameter: Concomitant medications - Phase Ib: to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of E7820 recommended for Phase II when administered in combination with Irinotecan in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy; Phase II: to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E7820 administered in combination with Irinotecan, compared with FOLFIRI alone, in patients with locally advanced or mCRC who have failed first-line therapy.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Participants will be followed for the duration of the study, an expected average of 18 months

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety parameter: lab tests - Phase Ib: to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of E7820 recommended for Phase II when administered in combination with Irinotecan in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy; Phase II: to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E7820 administered in combination with Irinotecan, compared with FOLFIRI alone, in patients with locally advanced or mCRC who have failed first-line therapy.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed at Day 1 of each treatment cycle for the duration of the study and after termination of drug administration, an expected average of 6 months

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety parameter: ECGs - Description: Phase Ib: to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of E7820 recommended for Phase II when administered in combination with Irinotecan in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy; Phase II: to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E7820 administered in combination with Irinotecan, compared with FOLFIRI alone, in patients with locally advanced or mCRC who have failed first-line therapy.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed at Day 1 of each treatment cycle after termination of drug administration, an expected average of 3 years

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Efficacy parameter: Time to progression (TTP) - Phase Ib: to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of E7820 recommended for Phase II when administered in combination with Irinotecan in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy; Phase II: to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E7820 administered in combination with Irinotecan, compared with FOLFIRI alone, in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer(mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed until disease progression or death, an expected average of 18 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Efficacy parameter: Overall survival (OS - Phase Ib: to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of E7820 recommended for Phase II when administered in combination with the FOLFIRI regimen (irinotecan, leucovorin, and 5-fluorouracil [5-FU]) in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy; Phase II: to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E7820 administered in combination with the FOLFIRI regimen, compared with FOLFIRI alone, in patients with locally advanced or mCRC who have failed first-line therapy.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed until disease progression or death, an expected average of 3 years

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Efficacy parameter: Overall response rate (ORR) - Phase Ib: to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of E7820 recommended for Phase II when administered in combination with Irinotecan in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy; Phase II: to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E7820 administered in combination with Irinotecan, compared with FOLFIRI alone, in patients with locally advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) who have failed first-line therapy.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed until disease progression or death, an expected average of 18 months

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The purpose of the Phase Ib portion is to find out the highest dose of study drug that can safely be given when tested in a small group of subjects.
The purpose of the Phase II portion is to find out how safe the study drug is when taken at the highest dose in a larger group of subjects.
